greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of intersection points formed by drawing the line segments connecting any two lattice points of an n X m convex lattice polygon written as triangle T(n,m), n >= 1, 1 <= m <= n.
comment: If more than two lines intersect in the same point, only one intersection is counted.
reference: For references and links see A288177.
link: Lars Blomberg, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..325 (The first 25 rows)
Hugo Pfoertner, Illustrations of Chamber Complexes up to 5 X 5.
Hugo Pfoertner, Illustration of intersection points up to 6 X 6.
Index entries for sequences related to stained glass windows
xref: For column 2 see A333279, A333280, A333281.
